I thought he ran a blinder on his first start over hurdles at Chepstow last week, beaten by Kingston Queen, who looks a nice mare. Wherever we go next he'll take a bit of beating. 12-11-25

stable_tour.quote: He's every inch a chaser but will get started over hurdles this season. He was second in a point-to-point before coming here and then we gave him one run in a bumper at the back end of last season, when he finished third at Worcester. He'll probably start over two and a half miles. 21-10-25

quotes.race: Pertemps Network Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race) (Div I)
quotes.quote: This was the start. Idaho Sun has obviously learnt a lot, especially at the second-last, but I'm delighted to get things under way and thrilled to see him come through that. That's been a good race for us in the past [a 30,000GBP race at Ascot in November] and a real stepping stone to better things - Harry Fry, trainer, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Fitzdares Berkshire Winter Million Open National Hunt Flat Race (Category 1 Elimination) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I've always really liked Idaho Sun and he's proved us right at Newton Abbot and again today. He's got a great attitude and takes everything in his stride, this was only his second time on the track but he seems very professional about it already. He's still got a lot to learn but he coped with the ground well, he travelled nicely did everything I wanted him to do - Bryan Carver, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

runners.breeder: S C E A Le Haras D'Haspel

stable_tour.quote: He was placed in bumpers in Ireland and is bred to do well. He looks like a nice new recruit to go hurdling with. 24-10-25

She won a bumper last year but was a little keen on her hurdling debut at Worcester last month. She'll be seen to much better effect off a faster pace, and she has plenty of speed for two miles. 10-11-25

quotes.race: Ascot Partners "National Hunt" Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: They were two lovely horses pulling a long way clear. Beat The Bat is progressing and will have learnt more today. I love the way he came alive turning in and then he really knuckled down to beat another really nice prospect. We'll just build from here now and it will be interesting to see where we go next - Harry Fry, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He was runner-up to Dysart Enos at Cheltenham in December trying to give her 7lb and I'm trying to get a fourth run into him to qualify him for the handicaps. He's got entries in the Supreme and Baring Bingham but I think he could be interesting in the County or the Martin Pipe.  20-02-24

He was just touched off by Golden Ace on his debut and then went one better at Chepstow. You can ignore his run in the Grade 2 at Aintree, where he got bumped from behind and ran with the choke out and Bryan Carver just looked after him. He jumps for fun and we'll start him off over a stiff two miles with some cut in the ground. It'll be interesting to see if he can make into a Graded novice or run in some good handicaps in the spring. 04-10-23

quotes.race: bet365 Premier Novices' Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Jet To Vegas is lovely. I knew the trip was right for him. He normally has to go right handed but it was worthwhile taking a chance here. As he got tired he jumped straight, when he was fresh he jumped right handed. He'll go to Aintree - Lucinda Russell, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He was second at Perth last week, where he bumped into a nice horse. He was a little bit novicey at times, but he's a very good horse who stays well. He might stay a bit further than two and a half miles and he's got plenty of ability. He's a real fun horse to be novice chasing with this season. Graded races might suit. 29-10-25

runners.breeder: E Aubree & Mrs J Goffin Van Aken
runners.owner: Mrs G Van Geest & M George

quotes.race: Dornan Engineering Relkeel Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Lucky Place is an absolute terrier. He doesn't know when he's beat and galloped all the way to the line. I think we'll be stepping up in trip again because he saw out today's trip on soft ground. On spring ground in March, I think three miles [in the Stayers' Hurdle] is where we'll end up - Nico de Boinville, rider.

quotes.race: Howden Ascot Hurdle (Grade 2) (Registered As The Ascot Hurdle) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was plan B unfortunately. I'm not going to bang on about it but Lucky Place was meant to be going novice chasing but I couldn't see anywhere to go, so we brought him back into here instead. He jumps fences beautifully but maybe we'll keep that until next season now.  We're going to have to have a look if he stays three and whether he's a Stayers' horse. We could look at the Relkeel Hurdle on New Year's as a stepping stone - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: The intention was to go novice chasing last year as he jumped beautifully at home, but we had nowhere to run him so we slipped him into the Ascot Hurdle, which he won. He then won the Relkeel on New Year's Day and we went to the Stayers' Hurdle, but I don't know if he stayed or not. He's going novice chasing this season, staying at two and a half miles for now, and I think we'll be very disappointed if he doesn't take very high rank this season. He has a wonderful temperament and is a very kind horse in every way, so I think he can go to the top. 21-10-25

quotes.race: Pertemps Network Handicap Hurdle (Pertemps Hurdle Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was great Thomas Mor could do it after such a long layoff. I've had him around three months and I was delighted with him. He's obviously a thorough stayer and he's a big horse too, so he's taken a fair bit of time to get ready - but he's ready now. He's lovely but he's also quite good. I've no idea what we'll do now as we were going novice chasing. His form from before is good, he obviously retains his ability and although he's eight, hopefully there will be room for improvement because he hasn't run that much - Philip Hobbs, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Lenny Roberts Memorial Trophy Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I think that race might have fallen apart and when we took the favourite on, that played to our advantage. I don't think Thomas Mor will want it winter soft, but we'll see. He's a lovely type and will be chasing down the line - David Pipe, trainer

stable_tour.quote: He joined us after winning his point-to-point at Bartlemy last May and made an immediate impact, winning a maiden hurdle at Worcester. He then went to Wincanton where he was impressive. After that we upped him in class for the Challow Hurdle but it poured on the day and it was far too soft for him. He definitely prefers good ground and he bounced back to form at Ascot on Saturday, where he quickened up very well. He is in the Albert Bartlett at Cheltenham but we will wait and see what the handicapper does. Cheltenham is a big ask for a young horse and we will see what the owners want to do, but he is going make a cracking chaser. 22-02-23

quotes.race: Clarke Chase (A Handicap Chase) (For The Sir Stanley And Lady Clarke Challenge Trophy) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That's two wins out of his last three starts, so I think it's a record for Your Darling. We're chuffed to pieces because I thought the ground was against him, but he looked to enjoy it. He travelled and jumped well and had to battle at the end.   It's all about his headspace - there's nothing ever wrong with him. I knew halfway round he was going to run well today. You enjoy every day as they come and hopefully he can go back to Ascot in November - Ben Pauling, trainer.

quotes.race: S.A.F.E. Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Your Darling is the most frustrating horse I'll ever train - if only he turned up every time. He's probably one of the most talented horses I've trained for a long time and when he wants to do it, he's electric. When he got in deep to one there, he still landed 15 yards out the other side of it but he doesn't want to do it, he flops through it. It's quite clear the rating doesn't overly matter to him, it's whether he wants to do it or not. He'll probably go up another 6lb for that and get thumped because he doesn't want to know. So we'll put him away now and go straight to the Topham Chase  - Ben Pauling, trainer.

quotes.race: Premier Food Courts Standard Open National Hunt Flat Race
quotes.quote: We knew Your Darling was very good and when you get one as good you hope they go and do it on the course. He's handled that ground, but wouldn't want it. We wanted to go hurdling, but because the yard was under a cloud we came down the bumper route and will stay here for the rest of the season. We'll see about the Champion Bumper and are not in a rush, but he'll run somewhere before the summer. He's got plenty of speed and we'll stick to two miles when he goes hurdling, but that was a nice start. He's one of the best horses we've had - he's got everything in his life. He's not stupid, he takes it all in his stride, his very healthy and sound and is a lovely horse to go forward with - Ben Pauling, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He was in the Grand Sefton but we thought we'd look towards the race he's won twice at Ascot this month instead. He's a legend and he seems as good as ever, and I'm pleased with where we are. He goes well fresh, so we'd like to pick a target that might pay his way for the season straight off the bat. 07-11-25

He is possibly the biggest head scratcher in the yard as he is so talented on his day. That said, he has won two of his last three races so he has not been doing too much wrong. He ran a perfectly respectable race last time at Aintree when coming home fifth. I've learned he is very good fresh so I am now going to run him rarely, but when he does he will be ready to do a job. He will not be out again until Christmas at the earliest. 30-11-21

quotes.race: Dora Larner 92nd Birthday Celebration Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: He's been out of form for a little while but dropped to a nice mark today. Courtland had a year off and took ages to come back but today he looked really well and he felt better, he travelled better, and won nicely - Sean Bowen, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Sky Sports Racing Sky 415 Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: We've loved Courtland from day one - he's a lovely, kind horse, so laidback and has a great attitude. We bought him as a foal in Ireland so to see him grow up and then go on to win races is very rewarding. His form has been well franked and hopefully he'll make into a nice chaser - Gwyn Brace, part-owner.

stable_tour.quote: He had an injury after his last race, the bet365 Gold Cup at Sandown last April, but he's back in work and has done well. He'll probably have one run and then go straight to the Summer Plate at Market Rasen in July, a race in which he finished a very close second in 2023. 26-03-25
He's another new horse to us this season who was fifth on his first start over hurdles at Exeter on Haldon Gold Cup day. That looked a good enough race and he'll improve a fair bit. 23-11-23

He won his maiden hurdle at Exeter last December and then finished second in his next two runs, once in a novice and then in a handicap. He's been off since January but is now ready to run and is entered up at Newton Abbot on Wednesday. He is probably at his best on very soft ground. 30-10-24

quotes.race: Native River Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Jack [Tudor] has given him a great ride and Neon Moon has battled really well. He goes well fresh, needs decent ground and has always threatened to win a nice one. It' been a good couple of days - winning trainer David Pipe talking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Richard Perkins Memorial Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The race might've fallen apart a bit, but Neon Moon did it nicely and it's good to get him to win over fences as he ran in quite a few good races in defeat last season. I'd hope the handicapper isn't too harsh on him and he can build on it. He's always threatened to do something like that, but he probably needs things to go his way a bit. He's got some good form about Ascot so I suspect that's going to be an option - David Pipe, trainer.

quotes.race: MansionBet Merry Cheltmas Bet £10 Get £20 Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Neon Moon ran all right on his first start for us and we've always liked him. He disappointed last time, but he's had a wind op since. He'll be a staying chaser in time - Tom Scudamore, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He did it nicely when winning at Ludlow on his reappearance last week, although the race fell apart a bit. He'd done well last year without winning and ran a very good race when second at Ascot. He's slightly better going right-handed and will be going back to Ascot at some point. 31-10-23

He has yet to get his head in front this term, but ought to have won at Taunton on his penultimate start. He had the race at his mercy only to idle after the last and hand the race to Dead Right. The operation he had for his breathing appears to have done him well and he looked like winning turning for home against a well-handicapped horse at Ascot on Saturday and it was a career-best from him. He showed he stayed three miles well and apprecaited the good to soft ground. 22-02-23

quotes.race: Irish Thoroughbred Marketing Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We ran Lord Baddesley at Cheltenham and he unseated and then his head went a bit, so it's great to get him back here - on a decent-galloping track and nice bit of ground. He still got quite hot coming here and is still quite a big, buzzy creature, but during the race he did it well, which is the main thing. He won't have a hard time and we might call it a day for the season, although we could have a look at another one. He'll be a lovely chaser next season - Chris Gordon, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: We didn't learn much about him in the Badger Beer. We're not sure whether to aim low or high yet - there's a few ideas, but he's probably due a win and I can see him landing a nice pot this season. 14-11-24

We are now buying nicer young horses and this fellow is typical of that type of individual. Following two encouraging bumper efforts last season he made a winning debut over hurdles this season at Fontwell. He raced very clean and deliberate, which maybe cost him the odd length early on but as he warmed up he became very slick. There is an EBF qualifier at Wincanton coming up that I would like to run him in as it is over 2m which is his trip. If we can get him in the first four then it gives us another string to our bow at the end of the season. I will be minding this fellow this season as it will be when he goes chasing next year he will really start to show his strengths. 11-11-20

quotes.race: AK Bets Home Of Free Bets Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: We were hoping for a run like that and Manuelito didn't let us down. He might have one more run. He's quite versatile but he definitely does go on this better ground - David Pipe, trainer.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet EBF "National Hunt" Maiden Hurdle (Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: George's Lad has just got better and stronger from run to run. We thought he wanted a step up in trip and they didn't go quick so he was a little bit keen. He was already qualified [for the EBF Final] but the reason he came here was that off 115 he wouldn't be guaranteed to get in. I wanted to make sure of it. - Emma Lavelle, trainer, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

stable_tour.quote: He had a crashing fall when running a big race in the EBF Final at Sandown in March but he's  bigger and stronger this season. He was only just ready for his reappearance at Fontwell and took a couple of blows. He's come out of it straighter but Harry Cobden felt he might just have been thinking about that fall, so we'll do lots of gymnastic jumping to make sure he's confident. He'll certainly be further forward the next time you see him run. 05-11-25

quotes.race: Oddschecker Novices' Hurdle (Grade 2) (Registered As The Sharp Novices' Hurdle) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Fortune De Mer just needed the run last time at Uttoxeter. We'd been toying with putting a hood on him for a few runs now. He's a funny old horse  - we nearly didn't run him today because he wouldn't come out of the stable yard when he got saddled! We took the hood off and he came out, and we put it back on  - he is just that quirky type of character. The more runners, the better for him and I'll be working back from the County Hurdle with him - Dan Skelton, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He stepped forward massively from his Uttoxeter run when winning a Grade 2 novice hurdle over two and a half miles at Cheltenham last month. He got the fast pace he needs, Harry [Skelton] delivered him late and he did it very nicely. He's got a fair opening mark and he'll go back to Cheltenham for the novice handicap hurdle at the Paddy Power meeting as the next step in what we hope will be an exciting season. The plan would be to work back from the County Hurdle. 10-11-25

quotes.race: Manor Elite Horse Boxes Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We've got a few things to brush up with Hardy Du Seuil's jumping but I think he's a good horse. I think he's good enough to step into graded novice company, but the handicapper can't do too much with him so it could be another novice handicap for him first - Jamie Snowden, trainer.

quotes.race: Introducing Racing TV Novices' Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Mr Ellison's horse is probably a three-miler and we didn't go very quick, which probably suited Hardy Du Seuil. We didn't learn anything at Wetherby, but we've learned a bit more there - Gavin Sheehan, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He won a valuable handicap hurdle at Sandown in January 2023, but last term was a bit of a wash-out with a couple of niggly issues. He should bounce back this season. 06-11-24

He should have a nice handicap within his reach. We went chasing early with him, utilising his weight-for-age as a four-year-old, and he won a couple, but his jumping was a bit in and out, so we went back over hurdles last season. He won a decent prize at Sandown but chasing is the plan again and there's mileage in his mark. Two miles and soft ground is his bag, but I'm sure he'll stay further too. 28-09-23

runners.owner: The Time On Our Hands Boys' Syndicate
F J Mills & W R Mills

quotes.race: Jason Salleh Memorial Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Maybe it was because Moveit Like Minnie was in front, but he just ran out. He didn't give me much warning. I was down the inner and he ran out on the outside, so he's gone the whole way across the fence. I felt I had the winner covered, but I'm not going to say I definitely would have won because nobody knows. For the horse to do what he did probably means he had plenty left in the tank - Tom Bellamy, jockey.

quotes.race: RhinoBet Michaelmas Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: We learnt Moveit Like Minnie needs two miles. He was always fading at the last over further and he doesn't anymore. That was brilliant and we are chuffed to bits. He does need better ground and the Betfair Hurdle is usually on softer ground, but we will look at a better handicap now - Nigel Twiston-Davies, trainer.

quotes.race: Brian Dunlop Architects Kilkenny (C & G) Maiden
quotes.quote: Inner Success had been working like a maiden winner and I'm just happy he put it together today. Billy remarked that he is still a work in progress and he did his best to stretch them. He got to the line well and he took time to pull up which is always a good sign - Ken Condon, trainer

quotes.race: Visit Huntingdon For Your Next Conference Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: It looked as if Jubilant was always going to win and it's no surprise as we were waiting to run him over this sort of trip. We had to pull him out twice because of soft going, but he handled this ground which had dried out a bit. He could be a good spring horse before going chasing next season - James Owen, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's won a couple of novice handicap chases through the summer and wasn't disgraced at Kempton on Sunday. He'll be all right on the better ground in the spring. 24-10-25

quotes.race: BetVictor A Run For Your Money At Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The keys to The Boola Boss are a flat track and good ground and, like Becky [Curtis, trainer] said, two [miles] six [furlongs] is probably his perfect trip. Three miles probably stretches him and two and a half [miles] is probably a bit too short so ideal conditions really - Sean Bowen, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports.

quotes.race: William Hill Extra Place Races Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: The Boola Boss has been going really well at home and he's just come into himself. He did it nicely and I'm very pleased. He's quite versatile on ground but I'm not sure I'll keep him going now because he's a big horse and he might not want to be summer racing. He may go out on his break next week  - Rebecca Curtis, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: We found he had a bit of a bad infection the last time he ran, so you can draw a line through that run. He's been declared to run at Doncaster on Thursday in a 2m4½f handicap chase. 10-02-25

quotes.race: Grace And Dotty Fedora's And Feathers Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Better ground has done the trick and Awaythelad has skipped off of it. He idled a bit up the straight but he jumped really well - Ben Jones, jockey.

quotes.race: Luke Watson Memorial "National Hunt" Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Fair play to Awaythelad he's won that well. I thought we bumped into a good progressive horse (Joker De Mai) at Lingfield last time and this looked a good opportunity. He should go on from this - Kielan Woods, jockey.

quotes.race: Geoffrey Broomhall Memorial Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It's so good to see Masters Legacy back as we knew he was a nice horse. He could go over fences and is improving all the time, although he might not run that often as he does run up a bit light. He wouldn't mind softer ground - Sarah Hobbs, assistant trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He won at Exeter on Friday which was great, the race was a bit of a non-event with all the fences out but nevertheless his jumping was good. We'll remain over fences but I'm not sure where we'll go. 08-11-22

quotes.race: Full Circle Series At Punchestown Festival Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: I was really disappointed with Montregard at Newcastle but I think the cheekpieces have helped him here and he's toughed it out well - Tom Lacey, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's a nice horse of JP McManus's who won his maiden at the second attempt over hurdles when last seen at Warwick in April. I was really pleased with him that day; he was green but toughed it out and stayed on nicely. I'd say he's progressed through the summer and is set to return in a 0-105 handicap hurdle at Uttoxeter on Friday. He'll ultimately jump a fence too. A nice prospect. 20-12-23

He wasn't right last season but he came out and travelled like a nice horse on his debut over hurdles at Hereford. He's going to need further than two miles but I think he's got a chance of winning a novice and his fair share of races. 22-11-23

He had a good blow at Kempton, which isn't his track as everything happens too fast. He has plenty of ability and there's definitely an element of him not wanting to share it all. We might try a visor on him. He'll run in proper staying handicaps and should pop up in one of them. 05-11-25

quotes.race: L J S Fencing Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Things didn't go right for Vision De Maine last season, but he's a lovely, big galloping type who jumps really well - Jack Tudor, jockey, talking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Cappagh Browne Utilities Ltd Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: All Authorized was given a very good ride and everything worked out well. Fair play to the course, they must have done a brilliant job with the going because this horse can't go on anything other than slow ground. He's done it well today and he'll go straight chasing now. That trip suited him well, he's a brother to I Am Maximus so he should stay well - Gary Moore, joint-trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He won over hurdles at Plumpton in April, but he'll go back over fences now and I think he's a well-handicapped horse. He's a full brother to I Am Maximus and will keep on improving with age. He could be a proper horse. 28-10-25

stable_tour.quote: A bumper winner on her debut last season, she hasn't been the most fluent jumper over hurdles and we've done plenty of work on her schooling. quotes.quote: Ryan (jockey) did a great job and it's just a horse that's taken us a little while to figure him out. We started Whatacracker over seven because he shows lots of speed at home and we've gradually stepped him up. We thought he'd win at Newmarket last time and he disappointed us a bit but what we see at home is what we've seen on the track today - Mark Walford, trainer.

quotes.race: Fairfax Saddles Grassroots Series Middle Distance Final Handicap
quotes.quote: I managed to get a breather into Night Bear and thought I had it in the bag from a fair way out as he was in a good rhythm. He stays well and kept finding - Clifford Lee. jockey.

quotes.race: 100% Racing TV Profits Returned To Racing Handicap
quotes.quote: The step up in trip really suited Night Bear. He has a bit of scope - Paul Mulrennan, jockey.

prev_owners.owner: HM The King & HM The Queen
Townley Hall Bloodstock And D J Cox

quotes.race: Sign Up To Our Newsletter Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: I think Fascinating Shadow is a nice horse. He does everything right for me at home. We went to Dundalk with him, my first runner there in eight years, but I went up with him, and ever since he scored there the plan was to come here. He probably want nearly faster ground than that, but he'll be a nice novice horse for the year - Shark Hanlon, trainer.

runners.breeder: The Hon Mrs R Pease & Anthony Boswood

prev_owners.owner: Opulence T/Breds, Regents Racing Et Al

racecards.race_name: Midnite Aint Your Grandads Bookie Novice Stakes (GBB Race)

stable_tour.quote: He got off the mark in a Sedgefield bumper last month and will now go novice hurdling. He wants nice, spring ground and he works very well at home. He's schooled nicely as well and we'll look to run him before the ground turns, but I think he will be a nice horse in the spring. 24-10-25

racecards.race_name: Midnite: Built For 2025 Not 2005 Handicap

quotes.race: Nad Al Sheba Turf Sprint Sponsored By Emirates Skycargo (Group 3) (Turf)
quotes.quote: It was certainly harder work [than the last race]. Ponntos got into his normal groove and was slightly away from us which maybe suited him but not us; it would have been nice to have direct aim at him. West Acre got away well and got into a nice position. He dug deep, was gritty and galloped out well after the line. I fancy he could be even better over the six furlongs of the Al Quoz Sprint - Callum Shepherd, jockey.

quotes.race: Blue Point Sprint Presented By Longines (Group 2) (Turf)
quotes.quote: It was a track record and an extraordinary performance. West Acre is a lightly raced horse and we thought he'd come on for his last run. I wanted to come back to five because he's all speed. He's got a huge engine and hopefully we can keep him safe and sound and more forward with the rest of the season out here. The obvious programme would be to go for the Nad Al Sheba on Super Saturday and the Al Quoz on World Cup night - George Scott, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's a very sharp and professional two-year-old and he showed up very well in a racecourse gallop at Chelmsford. If he makes a good start to his career he could go to the Lily Agnes at Chester in May, hopefully on his way to Royal Ascot, and he's a nice prospect. 29-03-24

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Supports Safe Gambling Handicap
quotes.quote: The blinkers have worked a treat and Another Baar will go to the Ayr Bronze Cup now with only an 8lb penalty, which is excellent. He has plenty of ability, but we weren't sure if he was using it or not. The blinkers have obviously helped him get that ability out and given him confidence - Adrian Keatley, trainer.Another Baar got across and got a lead for as long as we could. I just gave him a bit of a squeeze and it was all very straightforward - Oisin McSweeney, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: NavanRacecourse.ie Maiden
quotes.quote: Air Force One is a horse that joined us last year. He has gotten stronger and had been showing a bit of pace. This was a nice place to start. I think he's a five furlong sprinter - Paddy Twomey, trainer.

quotes.race: D&H, Excellence In Nutrition Handicap
quotes.quote: Rhythm N Hooves has only got a burst for a furlong to a furlong and a half. My first couple of times riding him I struggled to work that out, but I've managed to get the hang of it now so I can conserve him until the last furlong. He's a good horse, he won at Ascot a few years ago and he's a star to ride - Billy Loughnane, jockey.

quotes.race: Palace of Holyroodhouse Stakes (Handicap)
quotes.quote: Rhythm N Hooves was inexperienced coming into this, it was only his fifth race. He learnt a lot at York the last day, that was a big shock for him going from all-weather novices through to these 20, 25-runner handicaps. He has obviously shown a high level of ability here, so hopefully we can either go to more of these high-grade handicaps, but I wouldn't put it past going for a Listed race maybe with him at some point - Archie Watson, trainer.

runners.breeder: D & S L Tanker Transport Ltd

quotes.race: William Hill/MND Association Great St Wilfrid Handicap
quotes.quote: It's a massive pot for a horse like Intervention. It's a big handicap for whatever horse it is, but at his age, he's just been an absolute star for us. We kind of felt he could run well, looking at the quality of the race this year. Outside the top three, it was a 0-90. With question marks against each of those three classier horses, we did feel that we had a decent chance and that the track would suit him - and it did. He wasn't much higher for Wolverhampton and he'd got good form on the all-weather off slightly higher marks. Martin [Dixon, brother and part-owner] got William [Pyle] booked very early on and his three pounds off was always going to help. We thought we were going to need a lightweight rider, so we thought we may as well take a little bit of weight off on top of that. William does seem one of those riders where some of these sprinters will just run for him - Chris Dixon, part-owner.

quotes.race: Win £2,000,000 With BetMGM's Golden Goals Handicap
quotes.quote: It was a fantastic win again and Intervention is just an amazing horse. That's eleven wins since we bought him, his last four on the bounce. He's going on seven, in the form of his life and is better than ever. It secures at least sharing the top prize for the all-weather horse of the month at the Arc (Arena Racing Company) tracks in December because that's three wins from his last three runs. We're thrilled with him, he came to us as a longstanding maiden and Mick's just worked wonders with him. He's a bit of a hero of ours, he's won more races for us than any other horse and he's a firm favourite - Chris Dixon, syndicate boss.

stable_tour.quote: Our winningmost horse with 11 victories. He had quite a few goes before we bought him and he's won all those races for us and well over £100,000 in prize-money. He's just a legend. He runs his race nearly every time and always seems to be in the money. He's come down to a good mark again for the all-weather season and he's ready to win again soon. He's having a break now and usually thrives through the winter. 26-09-24

runners.comment: May come on for recent yard debut and well treated on best form
runners.spotlight: Very useful sprinter on his day, including four wins on AW; recent stable debut sixth of 11 at Dundalk (6f) was no more than respectable but he may come on for the run and is well handicapped on best form.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Shane rode Michaela's Boy two weeks ago and said he might need it, but he was professional and I knew he wasn't going to run a bad race. He's a straightforward horse. He went to post really good and has been cantering on that ground at home. We might go to Chester for the Lily Agnes - Richard Hughes, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's a lovely chestnut we bought from Richard Hughes's yard and he has done nothing but please us. He's won his last two races for us at Newcastle and Chelmsford and, having arrived with a mark of 78, will be starting this season on 94. Although that's 16lb higher I think he's definitely capable of improving again. He was quite quirky when he came but we've ironed out his problems and I think we can go even further with him now as he's a much stronger individual. He finished down the field in a 5½f race at Chantilly on Tuesday, but hopefully he'll improve on that and he may go to all-weather finals day at Newcastle. The only problem is that the sprint there is over 6f and he didn't get that trip last year. That's not to say he won't now that he has bulked up, but I would prefer it if the race were over 5f. 22-03-23

quotes.race: Betfred 3YO "Dash" Handicap
quotes.quote: It was Sturlasson's first time in a handicap, and normally they'd say they need a run in a handicap because it is a different type of sprinting, but he did fantastically well. He won his maiden in Navan, and the thing we were happy with it that the first few furlongs there are a bit undulating and downhill, so he might have had a bit of experience there for this. Oisin [Murphy, jockey] said the three-year-old handicap sprint at Royal Ascot is made for him - that's where he said he'd do, so all things being well, we will. When he first ran in a maiden he was second to Bucanero Fuerte, who is favourite for the Commonwealth Cup, so we knew he was pretty useful - Kieran Cotter, trainer.

quotes.race: Navan Racecourse Maiden
quotes.quote: Sturlasson's work during the week was spectacular. He skipped along there and he loved it. It was a real professional performance and I'm delighted. The lads are saying they might go for the Palace of Holyroodhouse Handicap at Royal Ascot on the Friday - Kieran Cotter, trainer.

runners.comment: AW maiden/novice winner but struggled in handicaps since, including for new yard latest
runners.spotlight: Won 5f maiden/novice events at Wolverhampton for Robert Cowell at the end of 2024 but has struggled in three handicaps since, including finishing behind Michaela's Boy when both debuted for the Ado McGuinness yard at Dundalk three weeks ago; others are more obvious, despite having a good claimer up.

quotes.race: Sky Sports Racing HD Virgin 519 Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: He really is a little dude this horse. Mini Magna is tiny, but very tough, and he's definitely getting better with racing. He's the smallest horse I've ever trained but he must have a heart as big as his body - I'm really pleased for him. He's actually very well bred. We picked him up for 4,000gns but he has a lovely pedigree - it's not his fault he's small! - Ed Dunlop, trainer.

quotes.race: At The Races App Expert Tips EBF Restricted Maiden Stakes (Band D) (Qual') (GBB)
quotes.quote: He's well named anyway. Mini Magna is only a small thing, but he tries hard. He was good at the line, he's won a nice neck and he's got plenty of improvement to have - David Probert, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

stable_tour.quote: We've only got five or six juveniles. He's the one who's the most forward, the rest are a little bit slow to come to hand. He was fifth the other day when topweight in a nursery at Leicester behind Tees Aggregates. He ran okay but the ground was probably a bit quick for him. He's been fourth a couple of two-year-old before the season's end.times too and I'm pretty sure he'll win as a 07-08-24

runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C

stable_tour.quote: He's a nice horse who we like. I think we haven't seen the best of him yet - his trip is 7f. He's ground-dependent and it's too fast for him at Brighton this week. 07-08-24

quotes.race: Highbet Bet £10 Get £30 EBF Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Ninth Crusade travels well and I've got the Coventry in mind for next week. He did things a little bit wrong, and got a little bit lit up down the back when he got a bump. Cieren [Fallon] said he felt far more impressive than he may have looked visually. He quickened up and got a little bit idle waiting for a second bit of company. He has an awful lot of ability. He would have learned plenty from today and come forward a good bit. We'll see how he comes out of it when we get home, with Ascot in the back of our mind - Michael O'Callaghan, trainer.

quotes.quote: What could go wrong did go wrong but Hero Of The Hour still won - Chris Hayes, jockey, speaking on RTV.

quotes.race: Gannon Office Solutions Supporting Kildare Chamber Handicap
quotes.quote: Jazzy Dancer was a horse we have been patient with and he looks like a horse that can go in again. Hopefully the handicapper won't be too hard on him - Mick Martin, assistant trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's taken some time to come together mentally. He's a bit of a sensitive soul. He ran three times last year, finishing third twice in small fields. We started him back at 5f this year at Beverley, where he was still learning, and have stepped him up to 6f for his next run, which will be at Catterick on Thursday. 23-05-24

runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C

quotes.race: Thank You Mick Scott For 60 Years' Service Handicap
quotes.quote: We're only learning about Iva Batt. We would have been very disappointed if she didn't run well today. She did what she was doing at home. An ease in the ground suits and she does her own thing. She oozes ability but she reserves a bit for herself at times - Joe Murphy, trainer

quotes.race: Mallow Handicap
quotes.quote: Run Forrest Run jumped well and got plenty of cover early, as he can be a bit keen. Everything went to plan - Conor Stone-Walsh, rider.

quotes.race: NB Builders Merchants Novice Median Auction Stakes
quotes.quote: Run Forrest Run did it well enough, I was getting a bit lonely out in front a furlong out and with three quarters to go I thought oh no but he responded well. I think if something had come to me, he may have just stuck his neck out again. - Jack Mitchell, rider

quotes.race: Group Deals Available At Dundalk Stadium Rated Race
quotes.quote: Exquisite Acclaim travelled everywhere, was half-idling with me up the straight and I brought him over towards the rail. Once he did that he ran through the line well - Jamie Powell, jockey.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Acca Freeze Handicap
quotes.quote: Exquisite Acclaim has come back down now and he has got confidence. He's tough and he's hardy, and he's really putting his head down. He has a bit of class to him - Ado McGuinness, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish EBF Median Sires Series Maiden (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Exquisite Acclaim was good. He was giving weight to all rivals and still picked them up well. We've always held him in high regard at home and didn't think he'd have to wait until now to win his maiden, but he could be a nice progressive three-year-old next year - Shane Foley, rider.

stable_tour.quote: I was very pleased with him when fourth in the 2,000 Guineas Trial at Leopardstown. He might not be a top horse but is going the right way and could well be a nice Listed type. 14-04-22

quotes.race: Commonwealth Cup (Group 1) (No Geldings) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: I was nervous about the ground and James [Doyle, jockey] did say that Flaming Rib would improve for better ground. He's never been a bad work horse but he did a piece of work last week that was 'wow' as he beat a horse rated a good bit higher than him with ease. We watched it the whole way and we thought it was just a case of Flotus to beat. We did that and even the cameraman thought he'd won, then they panned out and Perfect Power's flying - he's an unbelievably talented horse. Second place is the first loser and it's never somewhere that nice to be but we're really proud of what he's done and we're looking forward to a rematch at some stage - Hugo Palmer, trainer.

quotes.race: Cazoo Sandy Lane Stakes (Group 2)
quotes.quote: Flaming Rib is a really tough horse who goes on any ground and that was definitely a step forward. We survived a stewards' enquiry in Ireland ten minutes ago, so we may have used up our luck! If we had been able to eyeball the winner all the way we might perhaps have got by him but he has certainly now justified going to Ascot for the big one - Hugo Palmer, trainer.

quotes.race: Boodles Secret Garden Conditions Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Flaming Rib has done it really well. When I started Michael [Owen] had a fantasy he might be a Guineas horse and we thought the Greenham might be a chance and he showed there he was a sprinter. Although he didn't beat a horse in that, he ran fantastically well. He's in the Prix Texanita [on May 16] but it might come quite quickly - Hugo Palmer, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: We're on a retrieval mission with him. He probably ran the race of his life in Hong Kong nearly two years ago to finish eight and a half lengths behind Lucky Sweynesse and it absolutely bottomed him. We're struggling to find evidence he's forgiven us for it but he's back training after a break and is off a potentially dangerous mark if we can rekindle the fire. 09-04-25

He has been a real money-spinner for his owners and he had some top-class form last year, namely a neck second in the Group 2 Sandy Lane Stakes followed by a second of 20 in the Group 1 Commonwealth Cup at Royal Ascot. This year we took him out to Doha for the Group 3 Dukhan Sprint, which he won under a fine ride from Oisin Murphy to net £190,000 in prize-money. He's had only one run back here when finishing mid-division in the Wokingham at Royal Ascot. He has to have the ground on the quick side to be at his most effective. The Haydock Sprint Cup on decent ground would be a target and then I suspect we'll be looking to geld him. After that he'd have a break before going back to Doha this winter. 17-08-23

quotes.race: Visit racingtv.com Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Monsieur Fudge had a nice trip round and he was a willing partner. The slight ease in the ground suited him and everything was in his favour. This was a step in the right direction and a win can give a horse a lot of confidence - David Egan, rider.

runners.owner: Dooley Thoroughbreds & J Fairhurst & Deepak Dhand

quotes.race: Membership At Gowran Park Fillies & Mares Claiming Race
quotes.quote: Gloriously Glam has dropped in grade a bit and she ran well in a claimer here before. She was sulking a wee bit on us and I'd say even the bit of juice in the ground has helped her. She ran a nice race for Jessie [Harrington] up the Curragh before the boys bought her online. She loves it around the bend there. She can jump out and dictate. Adam was very good on her, he took no messing and just sort of sent her. She likes that. She sulks a wee bit in behind. She will be able to hold her own in races like this and I think she will sneak a handicap somewhere along the line - Ado McGuinness, trainer.

quotes.race: Guinness Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Gloriously Glam got it easy in front which helps around here. She handled the ground well - Shane Foley, rider.

runners.breeder: Irish National Stud Mare Syndicate Iv

quotes.race: ARKequine ACME Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Dontspoilasale is a nice little horse. He's straightforward, tough and genuine. We thought he was going to run well so we're delighted. Hopefully he can improve on this. He seems to  be showing a bit more pace, but Wayne (Lordan) said 5f or 6f should be no problem to him so we'll see what happens - Natalia Lupini, trainer.

quotes.race: Twydil/Clovelly Irish EBF Fillies Maiden
quotes.quote: Serialise has come forward this year and got her act together. She wants that quick ground and I've been waiting for about three weeks. I'd say we'll stay at a mile - Jessica Harrington, trainer

stable_tour.quote: She ran really well when second in the big mile handicap on Irish Guineas weekend at the Curragh against the boys. She'll go for the Kensington Palace Stakes, which we won two years ago with Villanova Queen. This filly loves fast ground and she's a very uncomplicated horse who should run really well. She's got a big shout. 13-06-25

quotes.race: Fern Lane Handicap
quotes.quote: Mehmar is going the right way and is making up for lost time. Colin said he's very straightforward, pings the gates. I was lucky to find this race for him, with not so many runners. It ticks another box and gets the second run out of the way. We might go to the drawing board now and make a plan - Michael O'Callaghan, trainer.

quotes.race: Ardboyne Hotel Maiden
quotes.quote: Mehmar had good form at two. It was a fair ask after that long off the track. Michael thought he would come on for it, but he picked up and was very professional. He's a very strong horse and handles that quick ground well. You would hope he will keep progressing - Colin Keane, rider.

quotes.race: Irishinjuredjockeys.com Apprentice Claiming Race
quotes.quote: Autocrat ran well up here last week. He got into a good rhythm and when I asked him to pick up he did it nicely. He likes it up here and loves the surface - Dan King, rider.

quotes.race: William Hill Lengthen Your Odds Handicap
quotes.quote: Church Mountain has taken a while to come around to our way of thinking but we got him started at Leopardstown a couple of weeks ago and ran a lovely race. It gave us confidence to drop him in because he's won his other races for Denis Hogan making it. He looked like he won snug enough at the line so hopefully he'll be able to go to Galway and be competitive - Michael O'Callaghan, trainer, talking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Limerick Racecourse Handicap
quotes.quote: You'd call stall 18 a bad draw usually, but not with Church Mountain because he doesn't like traffic around him. If he's drawn low and misses the break, it can be hard for him to get going, but Dan is super value for his 7lb claim off those weights. This horse has won twice at Galway and hopefully will go back there. Even though he's a big horse, he seems to like good ground - Denis Hogan, trainer

quotes.race: James P. Cunningham Electrical Handicap
quotes.quote: Church Mountain picked up well and did everything for me today. I'd say he's going to make a lovely dual purpose horse, he won't be a horse until next year - Joey Sheridan, jockey.

quotes.race: Kenny Galway Volvo Handicap
quotes.quote: Church Mountain is one we always liked, but he's a massive horse and still not the finished article. He was green in front but he needed to be there because he is a 1m2f horse. Making the running was the making of him - Denis Hogan, trainer.

quotes.race: William Hill Top Price Guarantee Handicap
quotes.quote: I thought I had got up, it was nip and tuck. Gracesolution had a nice run here the last day and she likes to run fresh. She needs cover, I was delighted with the lack of pace and was there ready to pounce. I knew she had a good turn of foot, I was trying to nurse her for as long as I could, she got there and parked a little bit -Donagh O'Connor, jockey, speaking to Racing TV

quotes.race: Lake Isle Of Innisfree Handicap
quotes.quote: Gracesolution was a little bit harder on herself and maybe she has learned to race a bit better now, so you wouldn't mind stepping her up in trip a little bit, maybe up to 1m4f at some point - Ross O'Sullivan, trainer.

prev_owners.owner: Elb Bloodstock Ltd And R L Banks
Ms E L Banks And R L Banks

stable_tour.quote: We bought him back as I think he can keep improving. I wasn't particularly overwhelmed with his first run but I think he's not taken the cold winter as well as some of the other horses in the yard. He's not quite come to himself and we'll see how he goes on the grass, but I could see him taking a big step forward as he just strengthens up. 29-03-24

We didn't go much of a gallop which suited him down to the ground and he galloped all the way up the straight - Donagh Meyler, jockey.

racecards.race_name: Sign Up To GavinLynchRacing.com Mares Maiden Hurdle

stable_tour.quote: She's acquitted herself well in three bumpers, winning at Downpatrick before finishing third in a good Listed race at Gowran which has worked out well with a Cheltenham winner behind her. She's a filly for better ground, so she's on a break and probably won't be back until next summer for a hurdles campaign. We'll mind her as she's only four. 25-11-24

quotes.race: Follow @BetVictor On Twitter Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (For The Jacky Upton Trophy) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: There's a three-mile novice handicap chase at Ayr's Scottish National meeting which would suit Flash Collonges. He'd gallop all day and could go another mile at that pace, but he does want good ground - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: bet365 Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was a really good performance. We'd suspected Flash Collonges would be a better horse in a better race and he jumped really nicely. He wandered in the last 50 yards but he won with plenty in hand. Looking at the size of him, he should definitely be a better chaser. He'll probably have another run this season but I don't know where he's going to go. He's a lovely horse to look forward to - Harry Derham, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: MansionBet's Watch And Bet Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Flash Collonges is a nice horse. The race didn't quite suit him the last day, he's a big, raw horse so it was better making most of the running. He'll be a nice horse for the future - Harry Skelton, jockey.

quotes.race: Kenn Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race) (Div II)
quotes.quote: That was a pleasant surprise. Flash Collonges is a big baby, he's never been off the pace or away for a gallop or anything. He's taken time to come to himself, he's a great big horse and I thought if he finished fifth or sixth today he'd improve like tenfold for the run. He's still green as grass. Harry said he gave him a slap and he just took off and got to the front a bit soon. I can't stress how much improvement there'll be to come once he learns what he's doing. He's a lovely, lovely horse - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He'd be a possible for the staying handicap chase at Cheltenham's Paddy Power meeting, but the problem is he needs decent ground and it doesn't seem to stop raining at the minute. He's unexposed as a long-distance chaser and when we stepped him up to four miles in the Scottish National in the spring he was going really well when falling, although it was still some way from the finish. Given his preference for good ground, he may well end up back there next spring. He's normally a good jumper. 05-11-23

quotes.race: Willie Gibbons Celebrating 38 Years At Leopardstown Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Where's Frankie was suited by the tip and the rain during the week was a blessing. He'll go back to Fairyhouse now at Easter and that'll be it for the season - Karl Thornton, trainer

quotes.race: Early Bird For Easter Festival @Fairyhouse Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Where's Frankie just loves it around here. The last day over hurdles he pulled something early on and we've done a bit of physio and acupuncture on him since. We schooled him yesterday and I said he should be right enough. He loves those staying trips and we may as well just keep coming back here with him. The handicap chase for horses rated 0-140 here on Easter Monday is probably tailor-made for him. It's a couple of weeks earlier than usual, so he might get softer ground there and it might be safe enough - Karl Thornton, trainer.

quotes.race: Easter Festival 16th - 18th April Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Where's Frankie will come back here in April over fences. We thought he would handle the ground and he did - Karl Thornton, trainer.

quotes.race: Follow Fairyhouse On Social Media Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Where's Frankie did it well, it was very straightforward. He has a big raw frame and wasn't right all last year, but he's coming good now. He could come back here in two weeks - Karl Thornton, trainer

quotes.race: Tote+ Pays You More At Tote.ie Handicap Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: I'd say Where's Frankie has been a bit backward but he's been progressing this year. We've been pleased with his work and his jumping has sorted itself out - Donagh Meyler, rider

runners.owner: A Trappe, D Trappe, G Trappe & Exors of Late J J Gallagher

prev_owners.owner: A Trappe & Declan Trappe & Garry Trappe & James J Gallagher

quotes.race: Whistlin' Donkeys @ Fairyhouse Easter Saturday Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: The Miracle Man is a tough horse, he's from that Carrigeen [Kamala] family and they stay. He seems to like that ground. At one stage I was thinking we might let him off but they wouldn't be running on faster than that during the summer so we'll keep him out for a while - Arthur Moore, trainer.

runners.owner: Miss Patricia Coghlan & Diana Edwina Oakes & Guy Culliford

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late Trevor Hemmings

quotes.race: www.thurlesraces.ie Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: The form of the race at Listowel has worked out. It's great to give Shane [Fitzgerald] a winner as he made horses for us and he's never ridden River Vale before so I'm delighted. He's a great jockey and is a big asset as he carries no lead. I was a bit concerned about the ground but the horse jumped well. The ground was a concern, it was beautiful ground but I'd say he'd want it a bit softer - Michael Winters, trainer.

quotes.race: William Hill Pick Your Places Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Duffys Getaway won very well the last day and we'll go easy on him now and probably aim at Fairyhouse on New Year's Day or something in the New Year. Hopefully he'll come out of this okay - Philip Rothwell, trainer

racecards.race_name: Irish National Hunt Steeplechase CLG Beginners Chase

runners.breeder: Dr V Roger-Yves Simom Et Al

quotes.race: ClonmelRaces.ie (Q.R.) Maiden Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: C'Est Ta Chance had a good first run last year and we think he is better than his latest two runs, so hopefully he will make into a graded horse - Patrick Mullins, rider

stable_tour.quote: A point winner who will go novice hurdling now, he looks more of a stayer than a speed horse to me, so will probably want a trip. 25-11-24
A Ballinrobe bumper winner who is still a maiden over hurdles. Maybe I should be heading straight over fences with him now, but I would like to win a maiden hurdle with him before I do. 25-11-24

runners.breeder: Mrs Marie Illegems & Mr Francois Buzon

quotes.race: Bective Stud, Tea Rooms & Apartments Handicap Hurdle (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: This is a great pot to win. I've had some good winners, a couple of Grade 3s, but this is the biggest pot I've won. It worked out perfectly. Aidan [Kelly] gave Flicker Of Hope  a brilliant ride, he knows him well. He's a chaser in the making. I don't think he'll go again at Christmas, we might wait for the Dublin Racing Festival - Mark Fahey, trainer.

quotes.race: Kenny Galway Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Flicker Of Hope won that well. He's a nice, improving horse and the rain came at the right time. He's a horse that we are looking forward to - Mark Fahey, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's heading to the Albert Bartlett. He's a hardened horse over three miles and has been running in good, competitive handicaps. He has loads of experience and we'd hope he can run well. He'll be my first runner at the festival and I think he's good enough to be competitive. His third at the Dublin Racing Festival was a great run, and he stayed on well to win at Navan the time before. 20-2-25

runners.breeder: S A S Elevage Michel Rivaillon

quotes.race: British EBF Gold Castle "National Hunt" Novices' Hurdle (Listed Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I can't figure out what happened to Kiss Will at Cheltenham. It was too bad to be true, but he travelled really well here and coped with the trip. He could have a bright future. It was a big field and there was depth to the race - Paul Townend, jockey.

quotes.race: Fairyhouse, Racecourse Of The Year 2024 Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: It was a match from when we jumped off and I had the better of that before the turn in. Kiss Will lengthened well up the straight and showed a little bit more of a turn of foot than I thought he would. He could definitely be an exciting horse going forward - Paul Townend, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He was an emphatic winner of a hot Listed hurdle at Perth. He really appreciated the step up to three miles there and should develop into a nice staying novice over fences. I'm looking forward to seeing how he gets on when he goes chasing. 17-11-25

runners.breeder: Brittas House Stud And Grenane House

stable_tour.quote: This boy is not a bad horse at all. He beat Sounds Victorius when he won his bumper at Leopardstown last Christmas and that form has worked out well. It didn't look a bad maiden hurdle he won at Galway on Sunday and he is well worth a shot at a graded race next. 28-10-24

runners.owner: Mrs K Browne & Mrs Anne Coffey

quotes.race: Finlay Ford At Naas Novice Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: I know Sandor Clegane was beaten ten lengths but I thought he hit the line well and he jumped well. I would say he will go to Cheltenham now for one of the staying novice chases - Paul Nolan, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He ran well enough in the Galmoy and actually hit the line well, which he hadn't been doing, so I was happy to see that. He's in the Stayers' Hurdle and could go for that, but I'd love to see him have a crack at the Coral Cup ? that sort of race would suit him. If he got into a rhythm early, I could see him running a big race. 20-2-25

quotes.race: Lee Strand Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Zeeband will run in the 2m6f hurdle at Galway but might need to go up in the weights to get in - Paul Gilligan, trainer.

quotes.race: Adare Manor Opportunity Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Zeeband did it lovely and Jack gave him a lovely ride. He's only getting the hang of things over hurdles so hopefully he'll stay progressing. He'll be a grand horse for the summer and will jump a fence at some stage. Paul Carthy owns half of him with Natalie and his mother is quite ill in hospital so it's a great boost for him. Hopefully she'll get a kick out of it as well - Paul Gilligan, trainer.

quotes.race: Adare Manor Opportunity Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Zeeband had a few good runs and he shouldn't have run at Navan last time. The run came too soon after Fairyhouse. He's a fun horse - Paul Gilligan, trainer

quotes.race: William Hill Pick Your Places Northumberland Vase Handicap (Consolation Race For The Northumberland)
quotes.quote: The draw is obviously a big help here but the way Zeeband won you'd think he could have won from any draw. His comeback run at Newmarket was quite nice. He's obviously improved since then - he worked with a visor on last week and Roger (Varian) was quite confident this morning - Andrea Atzeni, jockey.

quotes.race: RacingTV Hambleton Cup Handicap
quotes.quote: Anything Zeeband does this year is going to be a bonus, I think next season he could be in for a good year - Eoin Walsh, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: He did well in the summer, winning the Northumberland Vase, which earned him an 8lb rise in the handicap. Unfortunately he has had a little setback and won't be back out until the autumn, when something like the Cesarewitch might be worth considering. 18-08-21

quotes.race: Ryan's Cleaning Apple's Jade Mares Novice Hurdle (Listed)
quotes.quote: Tareze is improving all the time. She is a big mare and is much stronger this season. That was a very good performance, she travelled well behind the pace and picked up well. She jumped super and I don't think she will have any difficulty dropping back in trip - Robbie Power, assistant trainer

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Mares Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Tareze is still only five and will improve plenty although definitely wouldn't want the ground any better than that. Darragh said it was safe though so we were happy to go - Henry de Bromhead, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She ran great at Limerick behind July Flower. We were delighted with her and she'll definitely step forward from that run. We'll look for a beginners' chase in the next few weeks. She won a Listed hurdle race over two and a half miles, so I think two miles four, two miles six and probably even three miles can suit her well. She's a good mare. 11-11-25

racecards.race_name: Michael O'Sullivan & Lorna Brooke Ireland V Britain (Q.R.) Challenge Handicap Chase

runners.owner: Michael Hannon & James McNamara & James Byrnes

quotes.race: Molson Coors Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Decimation has been knocking on the door and it was nice to get his head in front. The main challenger went but he stuck at it well and he's a lovely horse - Rachael Blackmore, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He's tipping away and looks the type who could do nicely over fences. You will see him out in a beginners' chase in the coming weeks and we're looking forward to it. 14-11-22

quotes.race: BetVictor Rated Novice Hurdle
quotes.quote: The Little Yank had a lot of trouble with ulcers and we couldn't figure what was wrong with him. He's going to be a smashing chaser for the summer - John Ryan, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Mares Handicap Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: Kilashee is a lovely mare. I thought she had gone too quick. I'm very sweet on her. I think she's a proper mare and she will jump a fence too - John Ryan, trainer.

quotes.race: BoyleSports Money Back On Every Race At Cheltenham Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Carlas Big Jim probably got an easy lead, but he acts well on that ground. Cal knows him very well and he says he jumps better when he's up there. We might run him next in a qualifier for the Full Circle Series at Cork - Louis Archdeacon, trainer.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Play "1 - 2 - Free" On Football Novice Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Duffys Hodey got a 9lb penalty for the last day and I thought we might be goosed coming here. But with only seven runners and being able to drop him in, I thought we might have a chance - Philip Rothwell, trainer.

quotes.race: Kilsheelan Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Duffys Hodey had been placed a few times but it just wasn't happening, so deserved this. We'll head to Limerick at Christmas for another handicap and hopefully he isn't murdered for winning today - Philip Rothwell, trainer.

racecards.race_name: INHSC Supporting Point-To-Points Hunters Chase

quotes.race: Masterchefs 2025 Maiden Hunters Chase
quotes.quote: Con's Roc won his point-to-point really impressively last year. Ideally, we'd love to think we could end up in Cheltenham and he'll have one run before then and hope to get him in - Terence O'Brien, trainer.

racecards.race_name: John Thomas McNamara Series (Q.R.) Handicap Hurdle

quotes.race: Minorstown Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Apologise went away from them today. At Limerick he was only doing enough but he has come on a lot for that. You would hope there is a bit more to come - Dara McGill, rider

quotes.race: Roche's Feeds Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Apologise was a cheap purchase but has had his problems. Thankfully we've got them worked out for today and he's got the job done - Gary McGill, trainer

quotes.race: Garrarus Beach (Ladies Pro/Am) INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Teescomponentsyess was another cheap purchase and he had been doing everything right at home, we like him now. He jumps well and will probably go hurdling now but he could go back for a winners bumper. We'll see how he comes out of the race and he is an exciting horse to have - Rachel O'Neill, assistant trainer

quotes.race: Bryan MacMahon (Pro/Am) Flat Race
quotes.quote: Themanintheanorak should have won in Tallow but he fell at the last when he was disputing and then he got injured in Lismore, he got a bad cut. He is not the best of jumpers but he is not the worst either. He's a nice horse to have - Eugene O'Sullivan, trainer.

quotes.race: William Hill Ireland Extra Places Every Day Handicap Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: Robindevidastar had never had a gallop on grass but I was confident he would run a big race, I don't think he would want very heavy ground - Philip Rothwell, trainer.

racecards.race_name: William Hill Each Way Extra Challenge Series Point-To-Point INH Flat Race

runners.breeder: M Jean-Charles Haimet, Mme Elza Petit & Mme Hannah Petit

stable_tour.quote: He's a lovely grey horse who won a maiden point at Dromahane for Colin Bowe. Everybody seems to like him here and he's working well. He'll appear in a bumper soon and we're looking forward to that. He could be one of our nicer young horses. 26-10-25
